required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Compliance With Long-Acting Reversible Contraception Administration
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Compliance With Long-Acting Reversible Contraception Administration Immediately and Early Postpartum Versus Interval Postpartum

brief_summary.textblock: This a randomized control trial to identify if patients who desire LARC are more likely to have success receiving the desired form of contraception if it is placed a) during the postpartum hospital stay, either in the immediate or early postpartum period, versus b) during the interval postpartum period as previously done.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized control trial with control group receiving LARC at 6 weeks postpartum and the study group receiving LARC in the immediate or early postpartum period. Outcomes will be measured by those who receive or do not receive LARC either in the hospital after delivery versus 6 weeks postpartum in accordance with the study subjects' randomized designation. Secondary outcomes of bleeding profile and satisfaction will also be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of placing LARC during the immediate or early postpartum period compared to during the interval postpartum period for LARC postpartum contraception methods.
primary_outcome.description: The outcome will be measured by a ratio. The total number woman who expressed a desire to have postpartum contraception placed and randomized to the appropriate arm will be the denominator. While the numerator will be the total number of women who have postpartum contraception placed per protocol. The two percentages will be compared using a ratio to express the comparison between successful implementation of LARC for postpartum contraception.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction with method of LARC
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with LARC will be assessed using a questionnaire aimed at asking the patient how they feel about LARC.

arm_group.description: Immediate or early placement of levonorgestrel IUD, copper IUD, or etonorgestrel sub dermal implant (within 48 hours) postpartum
Interval (4-6 weeks) postpartum placement of levonorgestrel IUD, copper IUD, or etonorgestrel sub dermal implant

intervention.intervention_name: Levonorgestrel IUD, copper IUD, etonorgestrel implant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant, desires LARC postpartum
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical contraindication to desired LARC, vaginal delivery complicated by fourth degree perineal laceration, history of pelvic inflammatory disease, uterine infection

facility.name: Tulane Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
